docs.name: EveryWare Global Inc. (EVRYQ) Long Term Growth Estimates History
docs.description:
Long Term Growth Estimates History for EveryWare Global Inc. (EVRYQ) per Zacks Research.

Exchage:

Currency: USD

Ticker: EVRYQ

Zacks Perm Ticker: ROIQ

OBS_DATE: Observation date on which these metrics were calculated.

LTG_MEAN_EST: Mean estimate for long-term growth (LTG). This estimate is for the next 3 to 5 years for both earnings and sales.

LTG_MEDIAN_EST: Median estimate for long-term growth (LTG).

LTG_CNT_EST: Number of estimates for long-term growth (LTG).

LTG_HIGH_EST: High estimate for long-term growth (LTG). This estimate is for the next 3 to 5 years for both earnings and sales.

LTG_LOW_EST: Low estimate for long-term growth (LTG). This estimate is for the next 3 to 5 years for both earnings and sales.

LTG_STD_DEV_EST: Standard deviation of estimate for long-term growth (LTG)

LTG_CNT_EST_REV_UP: Number of revisions up for long-term growth (LTG)

LTG_CNT_EST_REV_DOWN: Number of revisions down for long-term growth (LTG)

Premium Support is available for subscribers of this dataset: premium_support@quandl.com

docs.name: Rural population density (rural population per sq. km of arable land) - Sudan
docs.description: Rural population density (rural population per sq. km of arable land) - Sudan. Rural population density is the rural population divided by the arable land area. Rural population is calculated as the difference between the total population and the urban population. Arable land includes land defined by the FAO as land under temporary crops (double-cropped areas are counted once), temporary meadows for mowing or for pasture, land under market or kitchen gardens, and land temporarily fallow. Land abandoned as a result of shifting cultivation is excluded.

docs.name: Access to finance (% of firms identifying this as a major constraint) - Chad
docs.description: Access to finance (% of firms identifying this as a major constraint) - Chad. Percentage of firms identifying access/cost of finance as a major constraint. The computation of the indicator is based on the rating of the obstacle as a potential constraint to the current operations of the establishment.

docs.name: Corruption (% of managers surveyed ranking this as a major constraint) - Angola
docs.description: Corruption (% of managers surveyed ranking this as a major constraint) - Angola. Is the share of senior managers who ranked corruption as a major or very severe constraint.

docs.name: Overall level of statistical capacity (scale 0 - 100) - Morocco
docs.description: Overall level of statistical capacity (scale 0 - 100) - Morocco. The Statistical Capacity Indicator (SCI) provides an overview of the statistical capacity of over 140 developing countries. It is based on a diagnostic framework developed with a view to assessing the capacity of national statistical systems and monitoring progress in statistical development over time. The framework has three dimensions: statistical methodology; source data; and periodicity and timeliness. For each dimension, a country is scored against specific criteria, using information available from the World Bank, IMF, UN, UNESCO, and WHO. A composite score for each dimension and an overall score combining all three dimensions are derived for each country on a scale of 0-100. A score of 100 indicates that the country meets all the criteria.

docs.name: Overall level of statistical capacity (scale 0 - 100) - Latvia
docs.description: Overall level of statistical capacity (scale 0 - 100) - Latvia. The Statistical Capacity Indicator (SCI) provides an overview of the statistical capacity of over 140 developing countries. It is based on a diagnostic framework developed with a view to assessing the capacity of national statistical systems and monitoring progress in statistical development over time. The framework has three dimensions: statistical methodology; source data; and periodicity and timeliness. For each dimension, a country is scored against specific criteria, using information available from the World Bank, IMF, UN, UNESCO, and WHO. A composite score for each dimension and an overall score combining all three dimensions are derived for each country on a scale of 0-100. A score of 100 indicates that the country meets all the criteria.

docs.name: Overall level of statistical capacity (scale 0 - 100) - Macedonia, FYR
docs.description: Overall level of statistical capacity (scale 0 - 100) - Macedonia, FYR. The Statistical Capacity Indicator (SCI) provides an overview of the statistical capacity of over 140 developing countries. It is based on a diagnostic framework developed with a view to assessing the capacity of national statistical systems and monitoring progress in statistical development over time. The framework has three dimensions: statistical methodology; source data; and periodicity and timeliness. For each dimension, a country is scored against specific criteria, using information available from the World Bank, IMF, UN, UNESCO, and WHO. A composite score for each dimension and an overall score combining all three dimensions are derived for each country on a scale of 0-100. A score of 100 indicates that the country meets all the criteria.

docs.name: Cost to enforce a contract (% of claim)  - Afghanistan
docs.description: Cost to enforce a contract (% of claim)  - Afghanistan. This indicator records the cost to resolve a sale of goods dispute in local courts. It is expressed as a percentage of the claim, which is assumed to be equivalent to 200% of income per capita. No bribes are recorded. Three types of costs are recorded: court costs (including expert fees), enforcement costs, and average attorney fees. The data are collected through studying the codes of civil procedure and other court regulations as well as surveying local litigation lawyers (and, in a quarter of the countries, judges as well). Source: World Bank, Doing Business Project (http://www.doingbusiness.org/ExploreTopics/EnforcingContracts).

docs.name: Cost to build a warehouse (% of income per capita) - Afghanistan
docs.description: Cost to build a warehouse (% of income per capita) - Afghanistan. The cost for a business in the construction industry to build a standardized warehouse is recorded by this indicator and expressed as a percentage of the gross national income (GNI) per capita. Only official costs are recorded. The building code, information from local experts, and specific regulations and fee schedules are used as sources for costs. Source: World Bank, Doing Business Project (http://www.doingbusiness.org/ExploreTopics/DealingLicenses).

docs.name: Cost to get electricity(% of income per capita) - Afghanistan
docs.description: Cost to get electricity(% of income per capita) - Afghanistan. Cost to obtain an electricity connection (% of income per capita)

docs.name: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment), male - Aruba
docs.description: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment), male - Aruba. Technical/vocational enrolment in secondary (ISCED 2 and 3) as % of total secondary enrolment (ISCED 2 and 3), male is the percentage of all male lower and upper secondary students enrolled in technical/vocational education programs including teacher training, expressed as a percentage of the total number of male students who are enrolled in lower and upper secondary education.

docs.name: Youth illiterate population. % female - Aruba
docs.description: Youth illiterate population. % female - Aruba. Youth illiterate population. % female is the share of the youth illiterate population that is female.

docs.name: Youth illiterate population. Total - Aruba
docs.description: Youth illiterate population. Total - Aruba. Youth illiterate population. Total is the total number of youth between age 15 and age 24 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

docs.name: Percent of firms using material inputs and/or supplies of foreign origin - Angola
docs.description: Percent of firms using material inputs and/or supplies of foreign origin - Angola. Percent of firms that use material inputs and/or supplies of foreign origin.   Source:World Bank, Enterprise Surveys Project(http://www.enterprisesurveys.org/Data/ExploreTopics/trade).

docs.name: Percent of firms with a checking or savings account - Angola
docs.description: Percent of firms with a checking or savings account - Angola. Percent of firms with a checking or savings account.   Source:World Bank, Enterprise Surveys Project(http://www.enterprisesurveys.org/Data/ExploreTopics/finance).

docs.name: Percent of firms owning or sharing  a generator - Angola
docs.description: Percent of firms owning or sharing  a generator - Angola. Percent of firms owning or sharing a generator.   Source:World Bank, Enterprise Surveys Project(http://www.enterprisesurveys.org/Data/ExploreTopics/infrastructure).
